Fields.DialogueText: We have our orders. Get to your stations!
Yes, Captain!
Get us in shooting range, people!
@BATTLE
Ark Royal, please report.
Yes, Captain!
Are you all right? It seemed like you were struggling.
Hardly a trifle. In fact, I've attended parties with trifles more impressive than those Morganas.
...was that a pun?
Morganas have made the whole atmosphere of this world bleak, but that does not mean we can't try to lighten the mood.

Fields.MenuText: We need to be serious, not cracking jokes.

Fields.DialogueText: Trifles are also multi-layered desserts with cake, fruit, and cream. Quite delicious, I might add.
Morganas are not going to attack every second of our lives, Captain. Relax.
Ah, you're catching on!
Now, if you will excuse me, I have to check on the Skuas in the hangar.
I'm sure the crew just loves those puns...
Captain, I issue you a challenge.
As you may know, this ship was made for the purpose of housing numerous planes.
I'm well aware.
But I was also designed to be agile enough to hunt down prey. And I'm of the mind that any captain of mine should be similarly agile.
Hold up! Fast or slow, I'm still your captain.
But a good showing on your part would certainly give me confidence in your abilities. Come now, let's race.
...Fine. Let's do this.
Ready? Go!
*some time later*
Ha, ha! Your speed was admirable, Captain, but your endurance needs improvement.

Fields.MenuText: Why did I agree to this?!

Fields.DialogueText: Now, now, don't look so glum.
If so, you must practice.
Because you recognized the value of my confidence in you.
Now, don't worry - I will continue to serve you to the best of my ability. But I hope you will work to improve in this area.
All right, all right.
Oh, the sirens are calling. I hope you aren't too fatigued by our little contest.
I'll manage.
@BATTLE
Captain, how familiar are you with warfare?
If you're asking to review my records, I have no...
*ALARM*
Oh, the sirens. We will resume our conversation at a later time.
@BATTLE
Ark Royal! There you are. You disappeared after the Morganas fled.
Hmm, I did? Apologies, Captain. Seeing my pilots return to the ship brings joy to my heart.

Fields.MenuText: Don't run away like that. Especially after a battle - you had me worried.
They'll always come back. You don't have to greet them after every mission.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad to hear so, Captain.
I assure you, if there had been a problem, I would have let you know.
Perhaps you are correct...
Anyway, was there any particular reason why you were asking if I was familiar with warfare?
One day, you might find out. In the meantime, I have to greet my pilots.
... That girl is a bit of a mystery.
*ALARM*
All hands to action stations!
Tell that to the clock.
... Don't start.
@BATTLE
Great work today, Ar...
Captain? What's wrong?
Are those crumbs on your uniform?
Crumbs? Where?
All over your uniform. Look--
Oh! I didn't notice at all. My apologies.

Fields.MenuText: I'm surprised you didn't notice earlier.

Fields.DialogueText: Morganas occupy most of our attention. Battle is a matter of life and death, not cleanliness.
Something marvelous I found in the galley!
During an attack, my uniform's cleanliness is the last thing on my mind.
I was having a scrumptious sponge cake before the attack. You should have tried some!
Judging by the cross look on Cook's face, I'm going to guess you ate it all.
Look at it this way, Captain. At least I wasn't caked in blood!
I'll never get used to your puns...
*ALARM*
Those are the alarms. Stop gawking at the Morganas! Crew and officers, to your stations! Everyone else, return to your quarters!
Ark Royal, to me!
@BATTLE
Ark Royal?
You called?
Woah! Please don't sneak up on me. Why didn't you come when I called you earlier?
Ah... there were so many people on deck, all staring at those Morganas.
So?
I... well, I prefer to avoid large groups of people, whenever possible. Please understand, Captain.
Uh... I can't say I do.
Imagine treading water, and growing more exhausted by the second. When there are so many people nearby... that's how I feel.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you should try a different metaphor.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, Captain, you are a lost cause.
Happy to hear it. Next time, do call me in a place where there aren't quite so many people.
Never mind...
Not much for goodbyes, is she?
Captain! There you are!
You look chipper. What can I do for you, Ark Royal?
Please enjoy this fruitcake. You do like fruitcake, don't you? I know it's not to everyone's taste, but--
Where did you get this?
At our last port, I convinced the crew members to do some light shopping. It was a fruit-fool's errand.

Fields.MenuText: Ignoring the pun, where did the crew get the money to shop?

Fields.DialogueText: You are too kind, Captain. Please take as much as you like.
Fruit folded into a delicious custard. Captain, I must show you more of the world of sweets.
The Royal Family, of course!
Oh, one more thing, Captain.
Hm? ...Where'd you go?
Now she's just doing that on purpose.
@BATTLE
What are you up to?
Inspecting the ship's ammunition. And... thinking about something.
Hm? What's on your mind?
The destructive capabilities of the bombs aboard this ship are no laughing matter. In an instant, this bomb could wipe out an entire village.

Fields.MenuText: It's scary when you think about it...

Fields.DialogueText: These thoughts aren't new. They roll about in my head during every inspection I make.
Indeed, Captain. The crew makes use of this arsenal, but I'm sure many of them give little thought to the power they actually wield.
Whether my next pun will be as explosive.
There's the siren. Let's dash.
Keep at it, Captain!
@BATTLE
It may be morbid, but... it's fascinating, don't you think?
What are you reading?
It's a cookbook by Eliza Acton, Captain. One of the pilots stowed it under his bunk.
Won't he be upset that it's missing?
This book has been under his bed for over 128 hours. He's in no hurry to read it.
I've never heard of Eliza Acton. Do you know anything about her?
Oh, have I! Acton was a revolutionary in the cookbook world. Her book was aimed at common folk, rather than high end cooks, and--
Wait, "was?"
She's not a modern cook, Captain. Eliza Acton passed away in 1859.

Fields.MenuText: She must have been an amazing woman, if you hold her in such high regard.

Fields.DialogueText: It's really nothing, Captain. I'm just... pondering.
That she was, Captain. That she was...
Every word, Captain! I even found a fabulous recipe for sponge cake.
Unfortunately, Morganas are approaching from the south. Stay sharp, Captain.
Ugh, gone again? Was it something I said?
@BATTLE
Captain, a moment of your time.
*ALARM*
Save it, Ark Royal! We're under fire!
@BATTLE
Now that's the battle's over, take a look at this. Do you notice anything... wrong with it?
A recipe for a jam tart? It looks fine to me.
Captain! I made that recipe myself! Can you not take the time to give me more thorough feedback? Do you have no knowledge of cooking that you can impart?

Fields.MenuText: I know a decent recipe for tart crust, but it burns half the time.
I know a little about baking, but I'm afraid it's not enough to help.

Fields.DialogueText: Too slow, Captain.
Don't joke around. This is dear to my heart!
But then... who will read what I wrote?
Can't you ask the cook for help?
Not possible. I want to surprise the cook and the crew with my new recipe. But with no one to read it... I'm in a bit of a jam.
That was a good pun, whether you admit it or not.
What are you doing on the deck, all by yourself?
I'm thinking.
About what?
What will happen after we defeat the Morganas?
Will we really?
Neither do I. Hence, I am staring at the ocean...
Indeed.
Will the land war spread to the seas? If so, how will we Belles respond?
Won't you remain loyal to the Royal Navy?
I am loyal to Great Britain, just as so many other Belles are loyal to their own nations. But our primary opponents are the Morganas... I don't know what we'll do if they're gone.
Ark Royal...
Sorry, Captain. I suppose there's no point in fretting over such things before we've even defeated the Morganas. The land war isn't on the table.
*ALARM*
Speak of the devil and she'll appear. Race you to the bridge?
Don't underestimate me now.
@BATTLE
Everyone! I have brought you my "shipmade" jam tarts! Freshly baked this morning!
And no pun with the food? This is the best day ever!
Make the tarts for your angel cake back home, and she'll love you until the end of time!
We spoke too soon.

Fields.MenuText: Ark Royal, don't you have actual work to do?
The pun never stops with you.

Fields.DialogueText: What "work?"
You could say... the puns never set on our Empire.
If you ask me sweetly.
Forget I asked...
Here you go, Captain. Have some tarts on me! ... If we survive this Morgana attack.
Oh, come on - she took the tarts with her! That's just cruel!
@BATTLE
Hm...
Let me guess... thinking of a new pun?
The opposite. I'm thinking of people.
That's not the opposite, that's a different concept entirely!
Before our Skuas leave the roost, I take a look at their pilots. Many have a hint of fear in their eyes.
I can understand that. What I do not understand are the hints of excitement, anger or despair. Or the ones who have no hint of any emotion whatsoever.
War provokes different responses. You can't control how your pilots feel.
I'm aware. But they are facing true monsters. How are they not all deathly afraid?

Fields.MenuText: It's because they fight for you. They would go to the ends of the world to ensure your safety.
Maybe they are afraid, but don't show it.
They are all human. That's more than enough of an answer.

Fields.DialogueText: A touching sentiment. You flatter me, Captain, but you and I know that is not the real reason.
No... their true emotions are revealed inside their aircraft, when no other humans are there to judge.
That's not good enough!
Emotions are difficult to understand, sometimes. We fall in love with people who don't love us back and laugh when we hear tragic news.
Humans aren't meant to be understood.
If they are not meant to be understood, why do they sometimes quarrel when others do not understand what they mean?
I... don't know.
*ALARM*
... At least I can make sense of this. Come, Captain.
@BATTLE
Puns make sense. People don't.
Captain! Look at this!
Hm... what is that?
A rabbit's foot! One of our men gave it to me. He said it brings good luck to whoever holds it. How peculiar!
Look ahead! Morganas!
But...
@BATTLE
Why do rabbits' feet bring good luck to people, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Because a fairy sprinkles magic lucky dust on them.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll have to ask the cook about this.
I wasn't born yesterday, Captain. Please don't insult my intelligence.
Superstition or not, there must be some reason!
She actually walked away that time, instead of disappearing. Will wonders never cease...?
Put more flour in it, Lady.
Like so?
Perfect!
Ark Royal, where are you?
Right here, Captain. How may I help you?
Lady, the griddle!
Ah, I'm sorry! Captain, can this wait?
If you tell me what's going on.
I've devised a new recipe, inspired by Eliza Acton's cookbook.
Really? What is it?
A flat cake, Captain. It can be taken aboard aircraft without ruining the texture or quality.

Fields.MenuText: That's wonderful. Can you come back to the bridge?

Fields.DialogueText: It is! You should see what it does when an aircraft completes a mid-air rotation.
Don't doubt me, Captain. My cakes are always a delight, even if they're upside-down.
But you haven't tasted it yet!
All right, I'll try it. It tastes...
Ah, yes! Thank you for noticing.
Oh, cook. I apologize, I've made a right eton mess of your kitchen.
... Heh, I'll take your puns over slaving alone. You've brought some joy to my work.
Of course!
*ALARM*
Captain, the Morganas have ambushed us!
Fantastic.
@BATTLE
Delicious! Ark Royal, this is wonderful. Is that cream filling?
Ark Royal, I challenge you to a battle of wits!
Really, Captain?
You've challenged me, now I challenge you. Turnabout is fair play.
Captain, with all due respect, you've failed the endurance test and my high quality pun challenges. Are you sure you're equal to the task?
Wait, when was I tested for puns?
Surprise exams. You've failed each one, I'm afraid.
Well, I'm prepared. I'll take on your puns in a pun war.
How cute. Shall I begin?
What's wrong?
Too late now!
Why would I? You're speaking to the Neutrality Fleet's pun master!
Morganas off the starboard bow! Get to the bridge.
Somehow, our roles have switched. Not for long, Captain. Not for long...
@BATTLE
Are you reading Eliza Acton's book again?
Yes, Captain. I plan to become the greatest cookbook author in the entire fleet!
But to do so, I need to understand why Acton was successful.

Fields.MenuText: You said it before- she geared her cookbook towards the masses, not professional cooks. No one else had done that.
She was the best cook in the world. You can't top that.

Fields.DialogueText: I did. But how can my cookbook be successful, when I don't have that advantage? We can't overlook that question.
You sure? Belles have many abilities humans do not.
Perhaps, if you have anything insightful to add.
Ah... well...
Clarity is essential to a good cookbook, Captain. My recipes are somewhat... vague. Filled with flowery language and unnecessary words.
I've never seen you be so... self-critical.
That's how I improve, Captain. I must have an accurate assessment of my abilities if I'm to progress.
I suppose that's true.
*ALARM*
We have company, Captain.
@BATTLE
Multiple Morganas closing in, Captain!
Get the Skuas up in the air and show them what carnage looks like!
Vividly put, Captain.
@BATTLE
Um... Captain.
Ark Royal! Welcome back.
What is the status of your emotional system?
What?
Um...
Are you asking how I'm doing?
Yes, Captain.
Ah, that's good.
Get some rest, Captain.
Because I'm concerned about everyone's well-being.
Something on your mind? You don't ask questions for the sake of it.
I have been thinking about human emotions, and how you process them. I'm no closer to solving that riddle, but...
One... one Skua did not return, Captain.
Ark Royal...
He's dead. Before he left, I saw happiness in his eyes. Why? He knew he was going out to fight.
I wanted to know why he was happy. But now... I can never ask him. I'll never know what was going through his head before....
Ark Royal, I know you don't like to interact with large crowds... or anyone, really, aside from myself and Cook.
I think it would be good for you to actually speak to the rest of the pilots. It takes more than greeting them when they land, or offering them cake with a side of puns.
You're right. I will try to do better.
It's agonizing.
I know you can't even look people in the eye most of the time. ... That's like treading water for you, isn't it?
If that's going to happen, you need to do more than exchange pleasantries. You need to build a strong rapport.
Yes, Captain. You remembered...
Cake and puns and agility are my forte. Not human interaction.  I want to understand, but...
I've never quite managed that before...
You managed it with me.
I will try... to communicate with them.
Here you go, Captain.
Wait, what's this?
After the unfortunate scene at the galley that left you with nary a jam tart, I have decided to rectify the situation. Here is a basket full of them.
That is so thoughtful of you!
You could say it was...
My captain is learning! If only the crew could see you now!
Yes, the puns!
You know you want to say it, Captain.
Heh... you are a bit of a basket case, Ark Royal.
Hey, I actually tried!
*ALARM*
Always the worst possible moment.
@BATTLE
Morganas closing in, from the west!
We know! If you gave us a better warning, we wouldn't have been ambushed!
Everyone focus! If we die, it doesn't matter who's to blame.
@BATTLE
Captain? I need to have a word with you.
What's wrong?
You owe Ark Royal a lecture. Just because she's held in high regard by her navy doesn't mean she has an excuse to slack off.
If you have a problem with me, then tell me to my face.
That wasn't the best way to deal with that situation, Ark Royal.
What do you mean?
The crew needs to trust you, and you gain their trust by keeping lines of communication open, not scaring them into silence.
It seems you have difficulty dealing with any situation where emotional complexity is present.
What!? I do not!

Fields.MenuText: Ark Royal, you can't lie to me.

Fields.DialogueText: I can if I want...
What if I don't want to?
Captain ...
Communicate with me, Ark Royal. Honestly. Earlier, you said you were going to make an effort to talk with the crew. How is that coming?
I am not a perfect Belle, Captain. I make mistakes when I take on new challenges. Sometimes... I give up entirely.
And is this giving up on your earlier promise?
Think this over, Ark Royal.
Yes, Captain.
*ALARM*
Damn, not a moment's peace.
Do you want to race to the bridge?
Why not? I may not be able to beat you at your puns, but I've been working on my legs!
You cannot surpass fine English legs, Captain. But I won't say no to a challenge. Get ready.
... And go!
@BATTLE
How? How in all of the oceans did you beat me!?
I told you, I've been practicing. Now, don't you dare disappear on me, Ark Royal!
But... it's too much to bear.
Do you care about our friendship?
Yes, Captain.
Then stay and deal with these emotions. You don't want to find that you've waited too long again, do you?

Fields.MenuText: It's not the end of the world. I promise.
... I apologize. Didn't mean to hit your old wounds.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope so.
Easier said than done, I'm afraid.
No... It's fine. I have to learn to accept these emotions when they come.
Now what?
It's up to you. What do you want to do now?
I want to go think on the bridge.
That's fine. But if you need anything, I'm here.
Captain, can I ask you something personal?
I don't see why not.
If you perish here, is there anyone who would miss you?
There is no "perhaps." I would miss you, and that is all there is to say on the matter.
That is a shame. I, for one, would miss you if you were to expire.
You should know, because I would miss you.
Thank you, Ark Royal.
You are welcome.
Why this sudden thought?
You and I have both been surrounded by death. The bombs we carry, the weapons on my decks. The Skua pilot... he's burned into my memory.
And even though Eliza Acton died a long time ago... I can't stop thinking about it. It's become an obsession.
What has?
Death. It is delivered to humans and Belles alike. The emotions we have don't matter, because death will take everything away from us.
Ark Royal....
How do I live with that knowledge?
... More Morganas on all corners. Death has surely come to us.
Don't be so pessimistic. We'll see what the future holds soon enough.
@BATTLE
That is very personal.
Humour me.
Captain...!
Perhaps, next time, you could wait until after I've swallowed my tea before you slam papers down on my desk?
Ah, my apologies. These... are the recipes I've been working on.
Oh, that's wonderful! How many recipes have you written out?
Over 250. And it's finally finished. My cookbook... my masterpiece.

Fields.MenuText: I don't know what to say...

Fields.DialogueText: Congratulations would certainly be in order, I think.
I have, Captain. It's the responsibility of the cookbook author, I say.
You flatter me, Captain!
The reason I'm presenting these to you is... well...
What is it?
If I don't make it through this war... please, find a way to have them published.
You trust me to see it through?
More than anyone I know, Captain. You and I - we have a rapport, do we not?
Indeed, we do.
Perfect. Now, onto business - we have Morganas approaching us fast from the north.
@BATTLE
All right, I give you my word - I will do whatever I can to help.
Captain, I have another question for you.
Not now. Morganas are approaching!
It can't be helped...
@BATTLE
Sorry, Ark Royal. What were you going to ask?
Why do you believe life is precious?
Huh?
I've talked with the other crew members on the matter of life. Everyone is in agreement on the desire for life - everyone wants to live.
But... none of them seem to understand why life is precious. Why do we cling to it as hard as we do?
Life is precious because each life is unique. There's only one of you and me. Each of us can change the world for the better, and when one of us dies... that chance of a change is gone.
Only one... me?

Fields.MenuText: From now until the end of time.

Fields.DialogueText: And only one you...
Yeah!
That's... a long time.
You're a good ship, Ark Royal. You're so willing to face danger and defend those in need. You care about everyone deeply, even if you don't understand them.
Captain... I don't know what to say.
Your life is precious indeed.
Sometimes nothing needs to be said.
... There are crumbs on your uniform.
Oh, not again! I'll clean those up immediately. Excuse me, Captain.
What?
I listened to you. You were right. I do tend to get caraway... ahem, carried away with my thoughts, and I missed the Morganas as a result. In the future, I'll be more prepared.
Well... thank you for taking what I said to heart.
It's no trouble at all. Please continue to be frank. I appreciate your honesty.
You did it, Ark Royal.
Yes! I interacted with him when other people were around, said words without getting scared... it was a bit of a miracle.

Fields.MenuText: See? You always had it in you.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain!
Thank you for believing in me, Captain.
I did think about doing so, on a couple occasions...
This was all you, Ark Royal. I only nudged you in the right direction, which makes me even happier for you.
Captain... you'll make me shed a tear in front of the crew. And the Morganas...
Ah! Race you to the bridge?
Challenge accepted.
@BATTLE
You were right.
Captain, a word?
I've reached some conclusions.
Oh? And just what have you concluded?
In this war... there's no guarantee to anything. We can't be certain if anyone will be happy, sad, fearful, or even if they will live to see the next day.
The same goes for me, Captain.
Go on.
Captain.  On several occasions, I have been less than mature in my dealings with you and the crew. But... I need to progress beyond childish behavior. For everyone's sake.
Puns are fine once in a while... but I must also be sober minded. I must treat each day as if it might be my last.
That is why... I'm taking my recipes back from you.
Huh?
I need all the incentive I can get to approach every day with the proper focus. If I'm responsible for the publication of these recipes, I think it will help.

Fields.MenuText: All right, Ark Royal. Make me proud.
What if you do die tomorrow?

Fields.DialogueText: I will, Captain!
Absolutely.
Then I'll have died doing everything in my power to help you win this war.
Huff... I had forgotten how heavy these papers are, though...
*ALARM*
I'm headed for my station, Captain.
I'll be there in a moment.
Ark Royal...

Fields.MenuText: Puns or no, I'm happy she's on my side.
She really is one of a kind.

Fields.DialogueText: In essence, we are a facing an apocalypse. Every day could be doomsday.
